cont.entity_a: The board scraper is versatile, doubling as a chopper but not sharp enough to be considered a knife.
cont.entity_b: There are two different size blades, offering versatility in chopping sizes.

cont.entity_a: Works well on hard vegetables but tends to make mush of tomatoes.
The metal version might scratch surfaces but offers more flex than the plastic version.
cont.entity_b: The plastic material is brittle and prone to breaking, especially the hinge and base.

cont.entity_a: The scraper is durable, easy to clean, and features a comfortable grip.
cont.entity_b: The product is inexpensive but not durable, often breaking after a few uses.

cont.entity_a: The handle is too plump and hard to hold. The rubberized grip feels high-quality despite its affordability.
cont.entity_b: The chopper is easy to use but requires the vegetables to be pre-cut into smaller pieces.
Cleaning is difficult due to food getting stuck in the grid.

cont.entity_a: It has a straight flat blade, which is not as easy for picking things up compared to models with a shelf. The edges are straight, allowing cuts to the edge of a pan. It has measurement marks for even cutting and is handy for measuring dough.
cont.entity_b: The device is not suited for chopping cheese and can make a mess.

cont.entity_a: It is heat resistant, sturdy, and doesn't melt when exposed to high temperatures.
cont.entity_b: Effective at chopping onions and other vegetables but not suited for harder items like carrots. It is a good tool for uniform chopping but requires careful handling to avoid breakage.
Customer service is unresponsive and replacement parts are difficult to obtain.
